julia_executable_path.description: Full path to the Julia executable (including the file itself).

repl_env_variables.description: Additional environmental variables for the Julia REPL.

useFormatterConfigDefaults.markdownDescription: Whether parent directories and the home directory are also searched for a `.JuliaFormatter.toml` file.

julia.lint.run.markdownDescription: Run the linter on active files.

julia.lint.call.markdownDescription: This compares call signatures against all known methods for the called function. Calls with too many or too few arguments, or unknown keyword parameters are highlighted.

julia.lint.constif.markdownDescription: Check for constant conditionals in if statements that result in branches never being reached.

julia.lint.datadecl.markdownDescription: Check variables used in type declarations are datatypes.

julia.lint.disabledDirs.markdownDescription: Specifies sub-directories in a package directory where only basic linting is. This drastically lowers the chance for false positives.

julia.lint.iter.markdownDescription: Check iterator syntax of loops. Will identify, for example, attempts to iterate over single values.

julia.lint.lazy.markdownDescription: Check for deterministic lazy boolean operators.

julia.lint.missingrefs.markdownDescription: Highlight unknown symbols. The `symbols` option will not mark unknown fields.

julia.lint.modname.markdownDescription: Check submodule names do not shadow their parent's name.

julia.lint.nothingcomp.markdownDescription: Check for use of `==` rather than `===` when comparing against `nothing`.

julia.lint.pirates.markdownDescription: Check for type piracy - the overloading of external functions with methods specified for external datatypes. 'External' here refers to imported code.

julia.lint.typeparam.markdownDescription: Check parameters declared in `where` statements or datatype declarations are used.

julia.lint.useoffuncargs.markdownDescription: Check that all declared arguments are used within the function body.

julia.inlayHints.static.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable display of static inlay hints.

Please note that you also need to enable inlay hints in the LSP package settings (*Preferences: LSP Settings* from the command palette): `"show_inlay_hints": true`

julia.inlayHints.static.variableTypes.en.markdownDescription:
Enable type hints for variable definitions:

```julia
foo #= ::Int64 =# = 42
```

julia.inlayHints.static.parameterNames.e.markdownDescription:
Enable name hints for function parameters:

```julia
foo(#= bar: =# 42)
```
